channel.title: BBC News - Europe

item.title: Aukus pact: France and US seek to mend rift
item.description: The deal caused outrage in France, which lost a contract to build submarines for Australia.

item.title: Migrants freezing to death on Belarus-Poland border
item.description: The BBC finds stranded migrants facing sub-zero temperatures amid a row between Poland and Belarus.

item.title: Canary Islands volcano: 'Miracle house' escapes lava
item.description: The volcano on La Palma has been erupting since Sunday, destroying hundreds of homes.

item.title: EU rules to force USB-C chargers for all phones
item.description: Manufacturers could be forced to change devices to a uniform charging system.

item.title: Netherlands Covid: Boy wins court battle for right to jab
item.description: The 12-year-old can get vaccinated to visit his dying grandmother despite his father's objections.

item.title: Saman Abbas: Uncle of teen who refused arranged marriage arrested
item.description: Saman Abbas, 18, is believed to have been killed after refusing an arranged marriage last year.

item.title: Lithuania urges people to throw away Chinese phones
item.description: The country's National Cyber Security Centre found security risks in both Xiaomi and Huawei models.

item.title: German elections 2021: The conspiracy theories targeting voters
item.description: One wildly inaccurate claim suggests Germany does not actually exist.

item.title: Oleksandr Usyk: Who is the grinning Ukrainian set to face Anthony Joshua?
item.description: Oleksandr Usyk fights Anthony Joshua on Saturday - but who is the grinning Ukrainian who loves juggling?

item.title: Angela Merkel: Four expert verdicts on a contested legacy
item.description: When the German chancellor steps down, how will history remember her? Four experts have their say.

item.title: Barcelona: The toxic battle ripping apart a European giant
item.description: The tense battle between Barcelona president Joan Laporta and manager Ronald Koeman is tearing the club apart, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: Central African Republic war: No-go zones and Russian meddling
item.description: All sides are accused of planting landmines in a dangerous shift in the Central African Republic.

item.title: German elections 2021: 'Bazooka man' Olaf Scholz bidding for chancellor
item.description: The centre-left finance minister has led the polls in the run-up to the vote to succeed Angela Merkel.

item.title: German elections: Businesses face future without Merkel
item.description: Many companies in Germany are focused on short-term survival in the hope of medium-term revival.

item.title: World War Two: The brothers who fled Nazi occupation by kayak
item.description: The "Engelandvaarders" who paddled from the Netherlands to England 80 years ago.

item.title: Angela Merkel: What will Germans miss about the chancellor?
item.description: BBC Europe editor Katya Adler takes a road trip to find out how Germans will remember their chancellor.

item.title: La Palma volcano lava engulfs homes and swimming pools
item.description: Molten rock from the erupting Cumbre Vieja volcano is destroying hundreds of buildings.

item.title: Canary Islands volcano: BBC reporter on the evacuation of La Palma residents
item.description: The BBC reports on the evacuation of hundreds of homes in the path of an erupting volcano on La Palma.

item.title: La Palma volcano: Lava destroys homes in the Canary Islands
item.description: A volcanic eruption on the Spanish island of La Palma has demolished homes and caused evacuations.

item.title: Russia election: Footage is alleged to show ballot stuffing
item.description: Russia's interior ministry told reporters it had not registered any "significant violations".
